question: It is true that pollution is the introduction of harmful substances into the environment.
It is false that pollution only affects humans and not animals or plants.
It is true that pollutants can come from both natural events and human activities.
It is false that pollution does not affect water sources like rivers and lakes.
It is true that pollution can be categorized as natural and artificial (man-made).
It is false that only artificial pollution is harmful to the environment.
It is true that volcanic eruptions are a source of natural pollution.
It is false that wildfires do not contribute to air pollution.
It is true that dust storms can cause air pollution by carrying large amounts of dust.
It is false that pollen from plants does not cause any kind of pollution.
It is true that landslides and soil erosion can reduce water quality.
It is false that natural pollution is caused by human activities.
It is true that artificial pollution is caused by human activities like industries and vehicles.
It is false that air pollution from factories and vehicles does not harm human health.
It is true that water pollution is caused by dumping waste, chemicals, and plastic into water bodies.
It is false that land pollution is only caused by deforestation and not by waste disposal.
It is true that noise pollution is caused by traffic, machines, and loudspeakers.
It is false that excessive artificial lights do not contribute to pollution.
It is true that artificial pollution can be controlled by adopting eco-friendly habits.
It is false that pollution only affects humans and not animals or ecosystems.
It is true that volcanic eruptions release gases like sulfur dioxide, which can pollute the air.
It is false that landslides have no impact on water quality.
It is true that reducing plastic use can help reduce pollution.
It is false that deforestation does not contribute to pollution.
It is true that planting trees can help improve air quality.
It is false that noise pollution has no impact on human health.
It is true that industries and vehicles are major contributors to artificial pollution.
It is false that water pollution only affects marine animals and not humans.
It is true that light pollution affects sleep cycles of both humans and animals.
It is false that air pollution is only caused by human activities.
